p: Several molecules with a structure clearly linked to the antispasmodic effect have been identified by our review. According to the surveyed literature, they are classified as alcohols (menthol), phenols (eugenol) [ 84], esters (linalyl acetate, neryl acetate, geranyl acetate, iso-amyl angelate and tiglate), ethers (trans-anethole, methyl chavicol or estragole, methyleugenol) [ 90], oxides (1,8-cineole, piperitenone oxide) [ 86, 91, 92] ( Figure 2). However, other constituents present in low concentrations could be important for the pharmacological activity.
